subject: help on new font
msgSnippet: Hi group, I am about to release a new font. When I do, hopefully users can give me feedback on how to improve it. Before I do, I need help with two items. 1.
messageBody:
Hi group,

I am about to release a new font. When I do, hopefully users can give me
feedback on how to improve it. Before I do, I need help with two items.

1. Unicode points. The will actually release two fonts, one with wan
ascii encoding scheme and one with a scheme using the Unicode points in
the private area. The Unicode font, based on the Gentium font, will
contain thousands of letters with the addition of the QS letters, so you
could use it on a web page and mix both Traditional Orthography and QS.

I have figured out how most letters correspond to these Uniocde numbers
with the exception of the 7 ligatures Ian, Air, Ear, Earth, Or, Are, and
Yew. I guess technically speaking, Unicode should not have ligatures. Is
that the reason they are not present in the current Unicode scheme?

2. I need a name for the font. I am thinking of just using shawtwo, as
QS is sometimes referred to. Other possibilitites:

catma (A shaw play on the words dogma)
shawclear
shawswill (Shaw's will which dictated money for a new alphabet)

???

Paul

Hi group,

I am about to release a new font. When I do, hopefully users can give me 
feedback on how to improve it. Before I do, I need help with two items.

1. Unicode points. The will actually release two fonts, one with wan 
ascii encoding scheme and one with a scheme using the Unicode points in 
the private area. The Unicode font, based on the Gentium font, will 
contain thousands of letters with the addition of the QS letters, so you 
could use it on a web page and mix both Traditional Orthography and QS.

I have figured out how most letters correspond to these Uniocde numbers 
with the exception of the 7 ligatures Ian, Air, Ear, Earth, Or, Are, and 
Yew. I guess technically speaking, Unicode should not have ligatures. Is 
that the reason they are not present in the current Unicode scheme?

2. I need a name for the font. I am thinking of just using shawtwo, as 
QS is sometimes referred to. Other possibilitites:

   catma (A shaw play on the words dogma)
   shawclear
   shawswill (Shaw's will which dictated money for a new alphabet)

   ???

Paul
